This game has terrible pacing. All the levels go on for too long and the gunplay is ass. When you shoot an enemy they don't react at all until the last bullet comes and they immediately flop to the floor. F.E.A.R. came out year after this game and was infinitely better in all ways except art design. Chronicles of Riddick: Escape From Butcher Bay came out the same year as HL2 and was better in every single way and somehow wasn't praised as much. That is the game everybody should have taken inspiration from, not the predecessor to Call of Dookie that is HL2.

Half-Life 2 is a singleplayer FPS set in the far future. Fighting large arrays of enemies ranging from antlions, to zombies, to the combine. There are many levels and chapters that never stop changing the gameplay. All the weapons have a purpose (with the exception of the 9mm pistol, late game.) The maps are very well decorated and the A.I. is very smart. The game is truely gameplay inspired since there are 2 cutscenes in the whole game. (beginning and end) Looting is a big thing, i found myself looking for crates to find ammo and health. The physics are amazing and the gravity gun isnt as OP as thought. There are vehicle sessions allowing you to drive with very well done driving mechanics. ( the airboat gun is so OP ) Theres also a compeling story. Though it may get confusing for those who havent played the first half life since there are so many references to the first game. Its also fun to just play with the gravity gun, ( i made a cooking show in the sandtraps chapter ) There are 14 chapters, each about 1-3 hours long. There is alot of content, unless you are a fan for multiplayer or co-op which is not featured here. (which was kinda obvious considering this is a half life game after all.) Thankfully there is a great save system that lets you save anywhere. I mostly used it when i died and got to where i left off, after being set back a little. There are puzzles in the game you must solve to get past a point or to get some much needed loot.

HOWEVER, this game aint perfect. Because theres no minimap or more cutscenes its hard to tell us where to go. I got confused and where to go and had to look to tutorials on how to progress because the maps fail to tell you where to go. The game has its share of glitches but not too many. One of which, stopping every scripted event (including a door opening -.-) The game IS challenging but to me, i felt that it was too much at times. *SPOILER* There is a part where you fight striders and then a combine base. But the strider would see you if you tried to attack the base of combine, the striders couldnt die because there wasnt enough rockets spawned in the map to kill 2 striders. So you had to fight the base with a strider on you with combine shooting at you ALSO. *END SPOILER* Loot in the game becomes more and more futile as you get better guns because you really will only use the AR and shotgun the most and therefore you will look for AR and shotgun ammo. The 9mm pistol NEVER gets used (late game) unless ammo for another gun is a problem.

Overall, a great game. Alot of good things about this game with not too many downsides ( but rly, the maps are really WAY too confusing ) So i can recommend this to someone who enjoys a challenging FPS,Puzzle,Adventure,Action game. I give this a strong 8/10, Great game!
Nada , mas que decir, excelte juego.

This game made me who I am today. 
Seriously. 
It was the first game that I played through and completed. 
As a young girl in middle school, Alyx Vance was such a great role model. 
The struggle of staying true to yourself when you're pressured by your peers is real. 
I know this is just a video game but, really, this game is everything, and I know I'm not the only one who was outstandingly impacted by this. 

If you like strong female role models, scary zombies, and saving the world, play this game.

This game has to be one of the worst games Ive ever played. According to everyone, Half-Life 2 is a masterpeice, but it reality, its absolute garbage. The game is basically Call of Duty: Ghosts that looks worse. It plays exactly like Call of Duty and has no changes from it. It has just about as much physics as Line Rider and is extreamly offensive to people from the Civil War era. From the start of the game, I hated it. The story was written by a guy who has never read abook or written anything in his life and the characters are bland piles of shit who talk all day long. Dispite this being an FPS game, there is absolutly no shooting in it whatsoever. That pisses me off. This whole game pisses me off. 7.5/10 too much water.

This game... Oh man this game... This is, by far, the best game I have ever played. I'm 15, but I still love this game, and I could play it a million times over if I could. This game definitely deserves a full sequel, not by "episodes", but by a full game "Half-Life 3". This game is the pinnacle of Valve's creations, and shame on the people who pirated this amazing game, just because they can't save up some cash to support the development of a (hopefully even more amazing) sequel to this masterpiece. The ending to this game is amazing, and the ending to the episodes are just BEGGING for a sequel.

If I were to rate this game, released only 6 years after Half-Life, I would rate 10/10 overall.
11/10 for graphics, especially for its' time.
10/10 for gameplay. My god is the gameplay amazing.
10/10 for creativity. A nuclear physicist, armed with only a crowbar and gravity gun, deserves high praise.
9/10 for game types. Multiplayer would have been a nice feature, but Half-Life 2: Deathmatch, and the length of single player definitely makes up for it.
10/10 for sounds. The sound effects in this game are phenomenal, and the voice acting is spot-on perfect.

Overall, this game is hardly debatable as the greatest game ever made. Anyone who always reads reviews before they buy it, I say BUY IT RIGHT NOW! Play the game, or be left in the dust with all the others who haven't seen the beauty of Valve's greatest achievement.

This is the most inspiring game I have ever played.

This game is so refreshing compared to the Half-Life 1, make sure you play it first.

Half-Life 2 é uma experiencia estupidamente incrível!

Prós:
- História muito bem feita, com personagens próprios, que tem reações diferentes e também caráteres diferentes!
- Uma longa jogatina, com várias armas pelo caminho e muitos inimigos...
- Inimigos inteligentes, atacando em grupos, dependendo do tipo de inimigo! Eles te cercam e pá! 
- Dois veículos usáveis durante a experiência!
- Vários bosses e confrontos de matar (no final alguém morre hehe)
- Save a qualquer momento, não há "Checkpoints".

Contras:
- O jogo acaba. 

Com essa review, só há uma nota possível: 10/10. Para fãs de FPS, Ação, Boas Histórias, esse jogo sem duvida é recomendado! Para os outros, é também altamente recomendado!

Wake up Mister Freeman, wake up and smell the ashes.

Half-Life 2 invented new gaming physics and the era of First Person Shooters. After many years of waiting for the sequel of Gordon Freeman's adventures, Gordon finds himself in City 17 and with the help of Alyx Vance they have to find out what the mysterious Combine and Dr. Breen are planning in order to conquer the world! 
This is an amazing game with a brilliant story and characters! Half-Life also is something for fans of the Portal series, because it's a crossover with Black Mesa and Aperture Science! The graphics are still great up to this date and the gameplay still is very unique. You feel sucked into this world when playing, because it feels so... immersive. Everyone who owns Steam should already own this masterpiece, and if not, why are you still reading this? BUY IT NOW AND WAIT FOR HALF-LIFE 3!

An absoloute masterpiece of a game. Just as good now as when I played it in 2004.
It's not the combat and story alone that make this game amazing. Any AAA company can throw those at you and call it a finished game. Half-Life 2 goes deeper than that. The enemies you face through the entire game only get stronger and think of as many ways necessary to kill you as the story progresses while staying relevant to whats happening at the time.

You need to experience this game at least once in your lifetime, even episode 1 &2. Please don't let this pass you.

Futurystyczna gra z 2004r. stworzona przez Valve Software. Tym razem trafiamy do City 17 gdzie tam i w jego okolicach musimy przeciwstawić się Kombinatowi. Powstała dzięki niej gra Codename Gordon (Half-Life 2D), która już nie jest dostępna na Steam jednak można ją wciąż dostać wpisując w przeglądarkę w pole adresu steam://install/92 . Polecam jej kupno. Jest najwyżej ocenianą grą na komputery osobiste.
Worth playing.
